poem_title: Some Reflections upon hearing the Bell toll for the Death of a FRIEND.
author: Joseph Giles

lines.line_text: HARK! — what a mournful solemn sound
Rolls murm'ring thro' the cloudy air:
It strikes the soul with awe profound,
Affects the gay, — alarms the fair.

stanzas.stanza_text:
HARK! — what a mournful solemn sound
Rolls murm'ring thro' the cloudy air:
It strikes the soul with awe profound,
Affects the gay, — alarms the fair.

lines.line_text: With what a pathos does it speak!
Affecting deep the thoughtful mind:
The golden schemes of folly break,
That hold in glittering snares mankind.

stanzas.stanza_text:
With what a pathos does it speak!
Affecting deep the thoughtful mind:
The golden schemes of folly break,
That hold in glittering snares mankind.

lines.line_text: 'Tis Death's dread herald calls aloud,
Proclaims his conquest thro' the skies:
The sun retires behind a cloud,
And Nature seems to sympathize.

stanzas.stanza_text:
'Tis Death's dread herald calls aloud,
Proclaims his conquest thro' the skies:
The sun retires behind a cloud,
And Nature seems to sympathize.

lines.line_text: Reflect, ye restless sons of care!
Your vain designs his hand can spoil,
Make hard oppressors lend an ear,
And wretched misers cease their toil.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Reflect, ye restless sons of care!
Your vain designs his hand can spoil,
Make hard oppressors lend an ear,
And wretched misers cease their toil.

lines.line_text: For what avail vast heaps of gold,
When Death his aweful writ shall send?
Tho' folly swell, and pride look bold,
The mask must drop, the farce must end.

stanzas.stanza_text:
For what avail vast heaps of gold,
When Death his aweful writ shall send?
Tho' folly swell, and pride look bold,
The mask must drop, the farce must end.

lines.line_text: It is not hoary tottering age
That now lies stretch'd beneath his stroke;
The tyrant stern, that feels his rage:
Th' oppressor's rod, that now is broke.

stanzas.stanza_text:
It is not hoary tottering age
That now lies stretch'd beneath his stroke;
The tyrant stern, that feels his rage:
Th' oppressor's rod, that now is broke.

lines.line_text: But oh! — 'tis generous Cynthio's bell!
Fall'n in his prime of youthful bloom:
For Cynthio sounds the doleful knell,
And calls him to the silent tomb.

stanzas.stanza_text:
But oh! — 'tis generous Cynthio's bell!
Fall'n in his prime of youthful bloom:
For Cynthio sounds the doleful knell,
And calls him to the silent tomb.

lines.line_text: Cynthio! — whose happy healing art
Turn'd from his friends death's fatal blow,
And shielded from that threatening dart,
Which now, alas! — has laid him low.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Cynthio! — whose happy healing art
Turn'd from his friends death's fatal blow,
And shielded from that threatening dart,
Which now, alas! — has laid him low.

lines.line_text: But Cynthio's virtues ne'er can die,
They leave a grateful rich perfume:
And now transplanted to the sky,
In heav'n's immortal gardens bloom.

stanzas.stanza_text:
But Cynthio's virtues ne'er can die,
They leave a grateful rich perfume:
And now transplanted to the sky,
In heav'n's immortal gardens bloom.

lines.line_text: And hark! — ah, what celestial notes,
With grateful accents charm my ear!
As down th' etherial music floats,
The sun breaks forth, the skies are clear.

stanzas.stanza_text:
And hark! — ah, what celestial notes,
With grateful accents charm my ear!
As down th' etherial music floats,
The sun breaks forth, the skies are clear.

lines.line_text: From heav'n descends the joyful strain,
Convey'd to earth on angels wings:
To mitigate our grief and pain,
And this the theme of joy it brings:

stanzas.stanza_text:
From heav'n descends the joyful strain,
Convey'd to earth on angels wings:
To mitigate our grief and pain,
And this the theme of joy it brings:

lines.line_text: "Thus write (the voice from heav'n proclaims)
"The virtuous dead are ever blest!
"Their works immortalize their names,
"Their labours cease, and here they rest.

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Thus write (the voice from heav'n proclaims)
"The virtuous dead are ever blest!
"Their works immortalize their names,
"Their labours cease, and here they rest.

lines.line_text: "Behold, the Saviour wide display
"The trophies of his gen'rous love,
"To cheer you thro' life's thorny way,
"And lead to flowery realms above.

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Behold, the Saviour wide display
"The trophies of his gen'rous love,
"To cheer you thro' life's thorny way,
"And lead to flowery realms above.

lines.line_text: "'Tis He destroys Death's baneful sting,
"And bids the grave's dread horrors fly,
"The choirs of heav'n his triumph sing,
"And hail him victor thro' the sky. "

stanzas.stanza_text:
"'Tis He destroys Death's baneful sting,
"And bids the grave's dread horrors fly,
"The choirs of heav'n his triumph sing,
"And hail him victor thro' the sky. "
